passages.name: Just Get the Treasure v0.9.1
passages.text:
Just Get the Treasure. 
v0.9.1


Thanks to the Orange Starfish Games Beta Test Team:
KB, FB, LTT, WS, DW, and "BotZero" (you know who you are)!

And thank you to the Interactive Fiction Competition staff, judges, forum members, and supporters! 

Composed in Twine. Visit https://twinery.org/

HINTS:
1. Make sure your browser is expanded large enough to see all selectable text.
2. Wherever you decide to end your game is exactly where you were meant to end it. 
3. It occasionally pays to look beyond certain endings.

[[Begin]]

passages.name: Peer into the chamber.
passages.text:
Edging along the wall, you peer into the chamber. You can see the Chalice of Destiny--the magical artifact and last hope of your people. It shines like a small sun, surrounded by a holy aura.
Marching back and forth in front of the Chalice of Destiny is a goblin carrying a halberd in one hand and a shield in the other. Emblazoned on the shield is a cruel mouth bearing fangs--the sigil of the evil warlock Malvox.

[[Steal the chalice when the goblin isn't looking.]]

[[Use stealth to kill the goblin as his back is turned.]]

[[Charge the goblin head on.]]

[[Talk to the goblin.]]

links.text: Steal the chalice when the goblin isn't looking.

destination.name: Steal the chalice when the goblin isn't looking.

links.text: Use stealth to kill the goblin as his back is turned.

destination.name: Use stealth to kill the goblin as his back is turned.

passages.name: Abandon the quest at the chamber threshold.
passages.text:
Yeah, never mind.

You can find a game that is more fun to play somewhere else.

Sorry!

[[The End.]]

passages.name: Steal the chalice when the goblin isn't looking.
passages.text:
Let's think about this for a second. Let's imagine for a moment that you could manage to sneak up to the Chalice of Destiny without being detected.

[[Ok.->Steal 1.]]

passages.name: Use stealth to kill the goblin as his back is turned.
passages.text:
You wait patiently for your opportunity to dispatch the goblin when he is vulnerable.

Now is your chance!

Will you...

[[Stab him in the back.]]

[[Slit his throat.]]

passages.name: Charge the goblin head on.
passages.text:
You are about to charge the goblin head on.
Are you sure this is the best strategy in this situation?

[[Yes.->Charging the goblin is best.]]

passages.name: Charging the goblin is best.
passages.text:
Okay. You are saying that charging the goblin is your best option.

But, you know, I just want to make sure you are completely aware of the situation.

I'm a little worried that maybe my description did not adequately convey the threat-level of this goblin.

Sometimes, when I use the term "goblin," people get the wrong mental image.
What do you imagine when I say "goblin?"

[[A small humanoid monster from folklore.]]

links.text: A small humanoid monster from folklore.

destination.name: A small humanoid monster from folklore.

passages.name: A small humanoid monster from folklore.
passages.text:
Yes, that's exactly the kind of confusion I was worried about.

When I say "goblin," I'm using a very precise ethno-species delineation. 

Unfortunately, human popular culture frequently contributes to a very significant misconception of what a true goblin is.

This goblin is much, much bigger and stronger than what you are probably imagining.

Now that I understand where you are coming from, it is safe to say that you would probably call this creature an orc or maybe even a troll.

But please keep in mind that such terms are taxonomically incorrect, if not racially insensitive.

So, now that you know that this goblin is a far more formidable opponent than you originally anticipated, do you still want to continue with your plan to charge the goblin?

[[Continue with the plan to charge the goblin.]]

links.text: Continue with the plan to charge the goblin.

destination.name: Continue with the plan to charge the goblin.

passages.name: Continue with the plan to charge the goblin.
passages.text:
I see.

I can't really stop you from charging directly at the goblin. It is entirely your call.

I just want to make sure you are completely aware that it is a very large goblin. A little bigger than you, actually.

[[Got it. I want to charge the goblin, now.]]

links.text: Got it. I want to charge the goblin, now.

destination.name: Got it. I want to charge the goblin, now.

passages.name: Got it. I want to charge the goblin, now.
passages.text:
It's not that I don't think you are perfectly capable of defeating the goblin, mind you.

After all, you've conquered many, many enemies to reach this point in your quest. And, frankly, some of those monsters looked far more powerful than this one.

But, of course, one might expect you to be a bit winded, having just won all of those battles and all. You might not be at peak performance in the goblin-slaying department at this point.

[[I'm fine to charge the goblin.]]

links.text: I'm fine to charge the goblin.

destination.name: I'm fine to charge the goblin.

passages.name: I'm fine to charge the goblin.
passages.text:
Good. Good. I'm glad you have the confidence you need.

I certainly wouldn't want you charging in there if you lacked confidence.

But are you sure you are physically up to this?

[[Yes, I am physically ready.]]

passages.name: Yes, I am physically ready.
passages.text:
Well, you would be the better judge than I on that issue, I suppose.

But something else occurs to me.

Before, I mentioned that you've already defeated enemies that looked more powerful than this one.

Doesn't that make you a little...suspicious?

[[Now that you mention it...->Why post a weaker guard at the end?]]

[[Not at all.->The goblin is just weaker.]]

destination.name: Why post a weaker guard at the end?

passages.name: Why post a weaker guard at the end?
passages.text:
Why would an evil warlock like Malvox post a weaker guardian in the chamber and put stronger guardians in more advanced positions?

It doesn't make sense, does it?

Wouldn't you want your last line of defense to be the strongest?

[[Maybe the guard is hiding something?]]

links.text: Maybe the guard is hiding something?

destination.name: Maybe the guard is hiding something?

passages.name: The goblin is just weaker.
passages.text:
Just asserting something is true doesn't make it true, you know.

[[Yes, it does.]]

passages.name: Maybe the guard is hiding something?
passages.text:
Exactly what I was thinking!

Maybe this goblin, who is already stronger than you, is actually much more powerful than he looks.

What if Malvox has cast some sort of protection spell on him?

What if he's actually invulnerable to a direct attack?

Doesn't he look awfully nonchalant at the moment? Like he doesn't have a care in the world?

[[Maybe a direct charge isn't such a good idea, after all.]]

[[I could still take him even if he has magic.]]

links.text: Maybe a direct charge isn't such a good idea, after all.

destination.name: Maybe a direct charge isn't such a good idea, after all.

links.text: I could still take him even if he has magic.

destination.name: I could still take him even if he has magic.

passages.name: Maybe a direct charge isn't such a good idea, after all.
passages.text:
Sometimes it is worth thinking things over again.

Let's take another look, and see if we change our minds.

[[Peer into the chamber.]]

passages.name: I could still take him even if he has magic.
passages.text:
What if he isn't even a goblin at all?

What if it is actually the evil warlock Malvox in disguise?

[[So be it. I will just have to overcome Malvox.]]

links.text: So be it. I will just have to overcome Malvox.

destination.name: So be it. I will just have to overcome Malvox.

passages.name: So be it. I will just have to overcome Malvox.
passages.text:
Do you have any idea what it takes to defeat an evil warlock as powerful as Malvox?

[[It doesn't matter. He must be defeated.]]

links.text: It doesn't matter. He must be defeated.

destination.name: It doesn't matter. He must be defeated.

passages.name: It doesn't matter. He must be defeated.
passages.text:
Look, this is no disparagement of your past accomplishments--and they are many--but a warlock? Really?

He can freeze your limbs with a word.

He can create giant fireballs in his hands.

He can call spirits from the vasty deep.

He could turn you into a newt.

[[Not if I kill him first.]]

links.text: Not if I kill him first.

destination.name: Not if I kill him first.

passages.name: Not if I kill him first.
passages.text:
I appreciate your optimism. That go-get-'em attitude has really served you well so far.

But I can't help but wonder if maybe, just maybe, this particular job might call for a little more than brute strength.

[[Stop worrying. I've got this.]]

passages.name: Stop worrying. I've got this.
passages.text:
How can I stop worrying?

I have a lot invested in this, too.

The fate of the world hangs in the balance.

If your decision to fight this creature head-on leads to failure, it isn't just your own embarassment and shame we are talking about.

Have you really thought about what's best for everyone else?

[[Of course, I have. That's why I'm on this quest.]]

links.text: Of course, I have. That's why I'm on this quest.

destination.name: Of course, I have. That's why I'm on this quest.

passages.name: Of course, I have. That's why I'm on this quest.
passages.text:
Sorry! Sorry!

I don't mean to upset you.

I'm only here to help you.

Now, back to the matter at hand.

You are absolutely, positively sure that a direct frontal assault on this goblin is the 100% best way to acquire the Chalice of Destiny.

[[Yes. I am 100% sure of a direct attack.]]

links.text: Yes. I am 100% sure of a direct attack.

destination.name: Yes. I am 100% sure of a direct attack.

passages.name: Yes. I am 100% sure of a direct attack.
passages.text:
Even after all of the points I have made.

[[Yes, still 100% sure.]]

passages.name: Yes, still 100% sure.
passages.text:
You obviously are determined to go ahead with this charge.

Again, I won't stop you.

But maybe we should conduct a little review.

[[I don't need a review->Charge Review]]

passages.name: Charge Review
passages.text:
So far, I have asked you to consider:

That the goblin is bigger than you initially thought.

That you might be tired from previous battles.

That the goblin might have unseen powers.

That the goblin might be a more powerful creature in disguise.

That the goblin might be the evil warlock Malvox.

That failure to defeat the goblin head-on will be catastrophic for the world beyond you.

[[Yes, I remember all those points.]]

links.text: Yes, I remember all those points.

destination.name: Yes, I remember all those points.

passages.name: Yes, I remember all those points.
passages.text:
And did I mention that if you fail, you will most likely die?

[[I assumed as much.]]

passages.name: I assumed as much.
passages.text:
And that the death would be humiliating?

[[That might go a bit far.]]

links.text: That might go a bit far.

destination.name: That might go a bit far.

passages.name: That might go a bit far.
passages.text:
Really? Because if anyone found out that you doomed the world to endless slavery all because you charged headlong into an uncertain battle at the very last minute...

Well...I think people would have things to say.

[[What kinds of things?]]

passages.name: What kinds of things?
passages.text:
Oh, you know, not nice things.

Like...

What an idiot!

What a fool!

What was he thinking?!?

That would probably be your own dying thought, as well. 

You would be lying on the floor about to be decapitated or vaporized or burned to a crisp thinking--realizing the horrible choice you made--and thinking, "How could I have been so stupid as to have made this choice?"

[[I am willing to face those consequences.]]

links.text: I am willing to face those consequences.

destination.name: I am willing to face those consequences.

passages.name: I am willing to face those consequences.
passages.text:
Would you like one last chance to change your mind?

[[Yes.->Abandon the charge]]

[[No.->Continue with the charge despite risk]]

destination.name: Continue with the charge despite risk

passages.name: Abandon the charge
passages.text:
Not a bad idea.

Maybe it would have been more courageous to attack head-on, but no one else ever has to know that you backed out of that plan.

In the end, the most important thing is the success of the mission, not whether or not people will judge you for being a coward.

So now that we have determined you would rather slink around than take a bold decisive move, would you rather...

[[Steal the chalice when the goblin isn't looking.]]

[[Use stealth to kill the goblin as his back is turned.]]

[[Talk to the goblin.]]

links.text: Steal the chalice when the goblin isn't looking.

destination.name: Steal the chalice when the goblin isn't looking.

links.text: Use stealth to kill the goblin as his back is turned.

destination.name: Use stealth to kill the goblin as his back is turned.

passages.name: Continue with the charge despite risk
passages.text:
Okay, then. Charge if you like.

[[Charge the goblin.]]

passages.name: Charge the goblin.
passages.text:
You rush into the room, screaming a battlecry as you prepare your killing stroke.

[[Strike the goblin dead.]]

passages.name: Strike the goblin dead.
passages.text:
Just so we are entirely clear, where would you like to hit the goblin with your sword?

[[Goblin's head]]

[[Goblin's torso]]

passages.name: Goblin's head
passages.text:
The head would be a good choice. Lop it off, and it is a good bet he is dead--even if he is a warlock in disguise.

But heads can be tricky to hit. For starters, they are a fairly small target compared to the torso. You could simply miss the target.

Or the goblin could duck or dodge and cause you to miss. He could deflect the blow with his shield or halberd.

Are you sure it is the head you want to swing at?

[[I am sure I want to strike the goblin's head.]]

links.text: I am sure I want to strike the goblin's head.

destination.name: I am sure I want to strike the goblin's head.

passages.name: Goblin's torso
passages.text:
The torso is a good choice. It would be hard to miss the goblin's torso.

But it is also harder to make a hit that will kill the goblin instantaneously.

What if the goblin still has enough life left to strike back?

Are you sure you don't want to strike at his head and end it all at once for the goblin?

[[Strike the torso.]]

[[I've changed my mind. Strike the head.]]

links.text: I've changed my mind. Strike the head.

destination.name: I've changed my mind. Strike the head.

passages.name: I am sure I want to strike the goblin's head.
passages.text:
What if...and just bear with me a second...

But you will have to be looking at his head to strike it.

I was just wondering what happens if you are looking at the goblin's head and end up looking into his eyes...

Are you emotionally prepared for what you might see there?

I know you've dealt a lot of death to reach this point, but can you bear to look into his eyes and see that moment when he realizes it is all over?

[[I will get over it.]]

passages.name: I will get over it.
passages.text:
Will you?

Truly?

What if you can't?

[[Then it is something I will have to bear.]]

links.text: Then it is something I will have to bear.

destination.name: Then it is something I will have to bear.

passages.name: Then it is something I will have to bear.
passages.text:
If you say so.

But I just want to make sure you are comfortable with the moral implications of a head-blow. There is a pretty significant chance that you will inflict a mortal wound. You could choose to target a non-vital organ and give the goblin a chance at survival.

[[I am fine with intending to kill him.]]

[[I hadn't thought about it in those terms before.]]

links.text: I am fine with intending to kill him.

destination.name: I am fine with intending to kill him.

links.text: I hadn't thought about it in those terms before.

destination.name: I hadn't thought about it in those terms before.

passages.name: Strike the torso.
passages.text:
Okay, but are you considering your back-up plan if you don't kill him in one hit?

[[Yes, I have a back-up plan if I don't kill him in one hit.]]

[[I don't need a back-up plan. I will kill him in one hit.]]

links.text: Yes, I have a back-up plan if I don't kill him in one hit.

destination.name: Yes, I have a back-up plan if I don't kill him in one hit.

links.text: I don't need a back-up plan. I will kill him in one hit.

destination.name: I don't need a back-up plan. I will kill him in one hit.

passages.name: I've changed my mind. Strike the head.
passages.text:
Maybe that's for the best.

[[Aim for the goblin's head.->Goblin's head]]

passages.name: Yes, I have a back-up plan if I don't kill him in one hit.
passages.text:
You strike at the goblin with your flashing blade.

Your skillful strike slashes across his torso, ripping into his armor and drawing forth a blackened stream of blood.

But the goblin seems almost completely unfazed.

It twirls its halberd overhead and begins to drop the blade onto you.

You choose to...

[[Deflect the halberd's blade with your sword.]]

[[Attack the goblin, again.]]

[[Dodge the attack.]]

[[Runaway.]]

links.text: Deflect the halberd's blade with your sword.

destination.name: Deflect the halberd's blade with your sword.

passages.name: I don't need a back-up plan. I will kill him in one hit.
passages.text:
How can you possibly know that?

It's not like you have any clue what your attributes are.

Do you think you can succeed here by just asserting your own strengths?

Don't you think that might just be a little obnoxious--especially considering that overestimating your abilities will almost certainly get you killed?

Look, maybe you are getting a little too anxious to wrap this up. I realize we've been going back and forth for a while.

But there's still time to rethink this if you want.

[[No need. I'm sure I will kill him in one hit.]]

[[You're right, and on second though, I have a back-up plan.->Yes, I have a back-up plan if I don't kill him in one hit.]]

links.text: No need. I'm sure I will kill him in one hit.

destination.name: No need. I'm sure I will kill him in one hit.

links.text: You're right, and on second though, I have a back-up plan.

destination.name: Yes, I have a back-up plan if I don't kill him in one hit.

passages.name: I am fine with intending to kill him.
passages.text:
So long as you aren't doing anything against your conscience, then I guess it's okay.

It's for the greater good, after all, right?

Who are you to quibble over the state of your own ethics and/or eternal soul (depending on your personal point of view regarding that sort of thing)?

It's not like it will be on my head. All I can do is ask you to think about the implications of your action for yourself and others.

[[I understand. Thank you. Now, can I kill him?]]

links.text: I understand. Thank you. Now, can I kill him?

destination.name: I understand. Thank you. Now, can I kill him?

passages.name: I hadn't thought about it in those terms before.
passages.text:
Do you want to reconsider this course of action?

[[Yes.->Peer into the chamber.]]

[[No.->I understand. Thank you. Now, can I kill him?]]

destination.name: I understand. Thank you. Now, can I kill him?

passages.name: Talk to the goblin.
passages.text:
Are you sure about this?

Your goblinese is a little rusty.

[[Yes, talk to the goblin.]]

passages.name: I understand. Thank you. Now, can I kill him?
passages.text:
You seem determined.


But before you strike your blow, there are some practical matters to clear up.

For instance, do you intend to make a sweeping slash or a stabbing thrust?

[[Slash.]]

[[Thrust.]]

passages.name: Slash.
passages.text:
This is probably a good choice for you.

After all, a sweeping slash covers more area so it is more likely actually to hit something.

Don't get me wrong. I'm not saying that you aren't good enough to hit a target with a stab.

But is now really the time to be taking big gambles that rely so heavily on your own personal skill levels?

People are really depending on you, and you would be risking their welfare as well as your own.

So, I don't think anyone will judge you too harshly for playing it safe.

So are you ready to continue?

[[Continue.->Slash 2.]]

passages.name: Thrust.
passages.text:
Okay. But keep in mind that a thrust requires more agility than a slash. A stabbing thrust requires pinpoint precision.

Are you still comfortable with this choice?

[[Yes, I am comfortable with stabbing.]]

[[Never mind, I want to slash instead.]]

links.text: Yes, I am comfortable with stabbing.

destination.name: Yes, I am comfortable with stabbing.

links.text: Never mind, I want to slash instead.

destination.name: Never mind, I want to slash instead.

passages.name: Yes, I am comfortable with stabbing.
passages.text:
Stabbing thrust it is then.

You ready your weapon and brace yourself for your attack.

But, hold on, we are missing something important. What part of his head do you intend to stab?

[[Stab his eye.]]
[[Stab his nostril.]]
[[Stab his temple.]]
[[Stab his mouth.]]
[[Stab his forehead.]]
[[Stab his neck.]]
[[I don't care. I'll just stab anywhere in the region of his head.]]

links.text: I don't care. I'll just stab anywhere in the region of his head.

destination.name: I don't care. I'll just stab anywhere in the region of his head.

passages.name: Never mind, I want to slash instead.
passages.text:
Fair enough. 

If you think you are ready, we can take the slashing approach instead.

[[Yes, I am ready.->Slash.]]

passages.name: Stab his eye.
passages.text:
Goblins have reasonably large eyes, so this is not an impossible task.

It also has a very good chance of puncturing his brain, which would assumably be your desired outcome given your prior thought-processes.

So, I guess this really is the way you want to handle this?

[[Yes, it is. I choose to stab his eye.]]

links.text: Yes, it is. I choose to stab his eye.

destination.name: Yes, it is. I choose to stab his eye.

passages.name: Stab his nostril.
passages.text:
Normally, I would say this was a bad choice given the relative size of the nostril to the rest of his head features. 

But since the goblin is a little taller than you, you actually might stand a chance. Maybe.

Assuming you can reach it.

[[I can reach his nostril. Let's stab it.]]

links.text: I can reach his nostril. Let's stab it.

destination.name: I can reach his nostril. Let's stab it.

passages.name: Stab his temple.
passages.text:
Really? That seems an awfully hard target to hit. Not only is he wearing a helmet, but I'm not even sure how you will get an appropriate angle to stab sideways during a forward charge.

Do you still want to do this?

[[Yes, I still want to stab his temple.]]

links.text: Yes, I still want to stab his temple.

destination.name: Yes, I still want to stab his temple.

passages.name: Stab his mouth.
passages.text:
Oh, jeez. That's pretty gruesome.

Even if you clear his iron-hard tusks and break his teeth, this is just a really horrible image to create and seems like it would inflict gratuitous pain.

Are you really that vicious?

[[Yes, I am that vicious.]]

passages.name: Stab his forehead.
passages.text:
Did I mention that he is wearing a helmet?

And that goblin skulls are hard?

This is probably the single least likely target to achieve a desirable outcome of all of the options I gave you.

Are you trying to lose this or do you just really like a challenge?

[[I am strong enough to pierce the goblin's skull with a mere blade.]]

links.text: I am strong enough to pierce the goblin's skull with a mere blade.

destination.name: I am strong enough to pierce the goblin's skull with a mere blade.

passages.name: I don't care. I'll just stab anywhere in the region of his head.
passages.text:
Wow. Okay.

I would have thought with your training and experience, you would have a more deliberate approach to this.

But, hey, you're the expert. Have it your way.

[[Stab in the general vicinity of the goblin's head.]]

links.text: Stab in the general vicinity of the goblin's head.

destination.name: Stab in the general vicinity of the goblin's head.

passages.name: Yes, I still want to stab his temple.
passages.text:
As the goblin turns to face your charge, you are forced to thrust at an awkward diagonal.

The goblin easily deflects your attempt with his shield, swings his halberd down on your elbows, and reduces your arms to mere stumps.

Fortunately, shock prevents you from feeling any physical pain as you begin to bleed out.

[[Bleed.->Temple stab ending 1.]]

passages.name: Stab his neck.
passages.text:
You must enjoy the sensation of goblin blood on your face.

So are you a hero or some kind of sadist?

I suppose those don't have to be mutually exclusive options.

Is this really the path you want to take, you psychopath?

[[Yes. Stab his neck.]]

passages.name: Yes. Stab his neck.
passages.text:
You rush upon the goblin; your blade moves steady in your tight grip.

As you skewer his throat, his unctuous blood splatters your face and sprays into your eyes.

The body fluids burn like acid at your corneas and you find yourself blinded for the moment--able to see only the blurred aura of the Chalice of Destiny.

But you are confident that your aim was true and that the foe is vanquished.

[[Reach for the Chalice of Destiny.-->Neck stab ending.]]

links.text: Reach for the Chalice of Destiny.-

passages.name: I can reach his nostril. Let's stab it.
passages.text:
You run at the goblin, thrusting your blade up towards his nostrils.

You didn't really stop to consider which nostril seemed a better target, however, and so you miscalculated your reach.

Your blow lands directly in the goblin's left eye, and your blade slides directly into his brain casing.

The goblin falls back dead.

[[Retrieve the Chalice of Destiny.->Nostril ending 1.]]

passages.name: Stab in the general vicinity of the goblin's head.
passages.text:
Really?

Look, it just seems like your heart isn't really into this thing anymore.

You know, I'm over here trying to come up with a variant ending for all of these little, nuanced choices that I'm providing.

If you aren't going to take this thing seriously, then, well, I'm afraid I just don't see the value of crafting a particularly good ending for this thread.

[[Continue.->General stabbing ending 1.]]

passages.name: I am strong enough to pierce the goblin's skull with a mere blade.
passages.text:
I dunno, you would have to be really, really strong.

It's a bit like trying to drive a nail into an oak tree using only your fists.

[[I am sure I can pierce the goblin's skull.]]

links.text: I am sure I can pierce the goblin's skull.

destination.name: I am sure I can pierce the goblin's skull.

passages.name: Yes, it is. I choose to stab his eye.
passages.text:
Right or left?

[[Right eye.]]

[[Left eye.]]

passages.name: Right eye.
passages.text:
It might be a bit more of a challenge if you are right-handed, is all I'm saying. Slightly more reach is required.

[[Never mind, left eye it is.->Left eye.]]

[[Still the right eye.]]

links.text: Never mind, left eye it is.

passages.name: Left eye.
passages.text:
It might be a bit more of a challenge if you are left-handed, is all I'm saying. Slightly more reach would be required.

[[Good point. Make it the right eye.->Right eye.]]

[[No problem. Continue with the left eye.]]

links.text: Good point. Make it the right eye.
No problem. Continue with the left eye.

destination.name: No problem. Continue with the left eye.

passages.name: Still the right eye.
passages.text:
Ah, I see.

Well, look...uhm...I have some bad news for you.

It didn't turn out well. You gave it a great try, but you just could not land the hit.

The goblin returned the attack, and...

It was pretty awful what happened next.

Just...I don't really feel comfortable talking about it here. Goblins can be real monsters, just utterly vile in their treatment of their enemies. It really wouldn't be appropriate to relate how he defeated you, nor the ignominy he inflicted on your person as you slowly died in his power.

But, look, you have been a really good sport so far. Really made some thoughtful choices. Really played along well.

While no one is looking, I'll cut you a break. Here's a psychic portal that will take you back just a few seconds in time. Maybe you can make another choice and things will end differently. It's up to you. I can't make any promises.

Just don't tell anyone I did this for you. I could get in big trouble.

[[Take the psychic portal.->I understand. Thank you. Now, can I kill him?]]

[[Don't take the psychic portal.]]

destination.name: I understand. Thank you. Now, can I kill him?

passages.name: No problem. Continue with the left eye.
passages.text:
As you stare into the creature's eye, you feel a dread weight upon your soul.

Your arms grow heavy, and your sword-tip clangs to the stone floor.

Your legs begin to wobble, your knees no longer able to support your weight.

The goblin's eyes glow unnaturally, and your vision blurs.

The form of the goblin dissolves into...

...the evil wizard Malvox.

You hear words you can't understand and feel your body become rigid, your limbs heavy. Your eyes begin to burn, then go blind. You feel like your chest is cracking as you try to breathe. You briefly taste the saltiness of stone, before everything goes silent.

Even your thoughts.

[[The End.]]

passages.name: I am sure I can pierce the goblin's skull.
passages.text:
Okay, here you go, then...

[[Let me pierce his skull already.]]

links.text: Let me pierce his skull already.

destination.name: Let me pierce his skull already.

passages.name: Let me pierce his skull already.
passages.text:
Charging at the goblin, you thrust your blade towards his brow. It cleanly shears through his noseguard, slices easily through his rough skin, and begins to crack its way into his skull...

[[Keep pushing the blade into his skull.]]

links.text: Keep pushing the blade into his skull.

destination.name: Keep pushing the blade into his skull.

passages.name: Keep pushing the blade into his skull.
passages.text:
Unfortunately, even with all of your might, the blade's edge fails to penetrate his skull.

[[Try to pierce his skull again!]]

[[Run away!->Failure to stab his head.]]

links.text: Try to pierce his skull again!

destination.name: Try to pierce his skull again!

passages.name: Try to pierce his skull again!
passages.text:
I don't think you are really grasping the situation here. The sword is stuck in his head. It isn't moving any further in no matter how hard you try.

But as you focus your energy on your futile attempts to kill the goblin, the goblin rams the blade of his halberd into the side of your skull.

His attempt to puncture your brain proves far more successful than your attempt to puncture his.

Your body twitches slightly before you lose your grip and fall to the ground.

[[The end.->Pierce his skull again ending.]]

passages.name: Failure to stab his head.
passages.text:
As you turn to flee, the goblin thrusts his halberd through your spine.

You see the tip of his blade emerge through your solar plexis. 

The goblin hoists your bleeding body aloft.

The ceiling, the wall, and then the floor roll before your eyes just before the goblin brings you crashing down upon your head.

[[The end.-->Head stab failure ending.]]

passages.name: Head stab failure ending.
passages.text:
There is a mercy that it was all over too suddenly for you to think long upon your mistake.

[[The End.]]

passages.name: Pierce his skull again ending.
passages.text:
As he withdraws his gore-covered blade from your open skull, a series of neurons suddenly fire.

You remember a time as a child playing on your gaffer's knee. He smiled at you and said something that made you laugh.

What was it he said?

It began something like, "You are the most..."

[[The End.]]

passages.name: Yes, I am that vicious.
passages.text:
You charge the goblin and thrust your blade into his mouth.

The stone-like tusks offer some resistance, and the blade jiggles in your hand, but your strength is enough to push the blade all the way through the base of his skull.

His spine severed, the goblin goes limp, crashing on top of you.

[[Push the goblin off of me.]]

links.text: Push the goblin off of me.

destination.name: Push the goblin off of me.

passages.name: Push the goblin off of me.
passages.text:
You try to push the goblin off of you as his cold blood trickles down onto your face. It is unclear if you lack the strength or the leverage, but you appear to be pinned.

While the goblin's limbs are now paralyzed, it appears to still have control over its face and jaws.

Its eyes wild with fury, its enormous tusks snap at your face, blood-stained saliva burning your eyes. Gravity pulls the monstrous head down the blade, its mouth inching closer and closer to your face.

As you continue your feeble attempts to push the goblin off of you,  you

[[Look away from the goblin.->Look away from being eaten.]]

[[Look at the goblin.->Staring down the maw.]]

passages.name: Look away from being eaten.
passages.text:
You avert your eyes.

The goblin whispers in your ear, "When you meet the Dark Lord in Hell, let him know that Adderfang sends his regards."

You feel his tusks drive their way into your cheek and scalp.

You shriek in pain as he crushes your skull in his powerful jaws.

[[The End.]]

passages.name: Staring down the maw.
passages.text:
It is hard to read a goblin's thoughts from his face, especially when that face is devouring yours.

Did you earn some degree of his respect at least, showing a last act of bravery and defiance?

Do goblins even understand what virtue is? Can they respect?

Or were you just projecting onto the goblin how you wished others saw you? 

In the absence of anyone whose opinion really mattered, did you cast value on his judgment of you?

Was this how you wanted to spend your last moments--in a futile attempt to ignore pain out of concern about how you looked to someone else?

[[The End.]]

passages.name: Neck stab ending.
passages.text:
Blind, you leave your sword in the goblin's neck, reaching out towards the source of the hazy light.

You stumble slightly as you feel a warmth emanating from the Chalice of Destiny.

[[Continue to walk to the Chalice.->Neck stab ending 2.]]

links.text: Continue to walk to the Chalice.

passages.name: Neck stab ending 2.
passages.text:
You are sure you are just inches away from the Cha...

[[The end.->Neck stab ending 3.]]

passages.name: Neck stab ending 3.
passages.text:
Sorry, about that.

It seems you were a bit overconfindent regarding the goblin's demise.

In your blindness, you were not able to see him staggering behind you. And you certainly didn't see him decapitate you in a single swing of his halberd--landing a blow so swift that your nervous system did not even have time to register pain.

If it is any consolation, I am allowed to tell you that the goblin died of blood loss shortly thereafter.

However, the Chalice of Destiny was never removed, and your people continue to live under the unbearable oppression of the evil warlock Malvox.

[[The End.]]

passages.name: Temple stab ending 1.
passages.text:
You black out.

And never recover.

[[The End.]]

passages.name: Nostril ending 1.
passages.text:
As you step over the goblin's corpse to retrieve the Chalice of Destiny, you consider the placement of your sword--now standing at an angle from the goblin's orbital like some kind of makeshift tombstone.

[[Consider the sword.->Nostril ending 2.]]

passages.name: Nostril ending 2.
passages.text:
Sure, the goblin is dead...but you kind of missed, didn't you?

It's not that you failed to get the end result, but you didn't really do it the way you meant to.

[[But that's okay, right?->Nostril ending 3.]]

passages.name: Nostril ending 3.
passages.text:
Sure, it's fine.

It was a small target, after all.

You really shouldn't beat yourself up for not having been able to hit it.

It was a hundred-to-one chance, really.

Just because you aren't among the top one-percent of sword fighters, that doesn't really tarnish your victory.

[[It's the end result that matters.->Nostril ending 4.]]

links.text: It's the end result that matters.

passages.name: Nostril ending 4.
passages.text:
But don't you wonder what went wrong?

Was it just sloppiness?

Were you getting too tired?

Were you trying to show off for someone?

Did you really need to aim for such a small taget anyway?

[[The End.]]..














































[[Apologies...]]

passages.name: General stabbing ending 1.
passages.text:
You stab at the goblin's head.

You kill him.

He's dead.

And...uhm...

You reclaim the Chalice of Destiny and return it to some Temple.

The bad guy's powers dissolves, his armies turn to dust.

Everyone's   free,

Your a herO1

Congradulatins.

Game over.

Special thanks to...
...
...
YOU!

[[The End.]]

passages.name: No need. I'm sure I will kill him in one hit.
passages.text:
So you just want to charge in and kill him, then?

[[Yes.->Charge in and kill 1.]]

passages.name: Don't take the psychic portal.
passages.text:
I respect that you are willing to face the consequences of your actions--even if no one else will know.

But I really can't tell you how you died.

It's too much even for me.

You will have to imagine it on your own.

May death release your soul from the horrors your body endured.

Rest in peace.

[[The End.]]

passages.name: Slash 2.
passages.text:
You run into the room, swing your blade in a wide arc towards the goblin's head.

The goblin deflects your blow with his shield and kicks you back.

[[Try again.->Slash.]]

[[Reassess the plan of attack.]]

passages.name: Reassess the plan of attack.
passages.text:
Well, the goblin obviously sees you, so you are pretty well married to another frontal attack.

[[Thrust.]]

passages.name: Charge in and kill 1.
passages.text:
You are sure?

[[Yes.->Charge in and kill him 2.]]

passages.name: Charge in and kill him 2.
passages.text:
Absolutely positive?

[[Yes.->Charge in and kill him 3.]]

passages.name: Charge in and kill him 3.
passages.text:
Not even the teeniest of doubts?

[[No.->Charge in and kill him 4.]]

passages.name: Charge in and kill him 4.
passages.text:
I mean, you must have some doubts, right? 

It's only natural.

To doubt one's abilities at least a little bit.

It's like a result of evolutionary psychology or something.

[[I don't know anything about that. I'm just going to kill the goblin.->Charge in and kill him 5.]]

links.text: I don't know anything about that. I'm just going to kill the goblin.

passages.name: Charge in and kill him 5.
passages.text:
Because if you had no doubts whatsoever, that could be the sign of a problem, couldn't it?

Complete self-assurance might be an unhealthy mindset.

[[My mind is healthy. The goblin is the one who won't be healthy. After I've killed it.->Charge in and kill him 6.]]

links.text: My mind is healthy. The goblin is the one who won't be healthy. After I've killed it.

passages.name: Charge in and kill him 6.
passages.text:
This is starting to seem really aggressive.

Are there ways in which your aggression towards the goblin might put yourself at risk?

[[What? No.->Charge in and kill him 7.]]

passages.name: Charge in and kill him 7.
passages.text:
You might be putting yourself in more danger than you realize, or you might be trying to deny how much danger you know there is.

[[You aren't even making sense anymore.->Charge in and kill him 8.]]

links.text: You aren't even making sense anymore.

passages.name: Charge in and kill him 8.
passages.text:
Why do you want to put yourself in danger?

[[I'm trying to get the Chalice of Destiny to save my people.->Charge in and kill him 9.]]

links.text: I'm trying to get the Chalice of Destiny to save my people.

passages.name: Charge in and kill him 9.
passages.text:
But you knew there was a significant chance that you wouldn't achieve the goal.

You knew that it might destroy you.

Why were you so willing to do something that seemed so impossible?

[[For the sake of my people.->Charge in and kill him 10.]]

links.text: For the sake of my people.

passages.name: Charge in and kill him 10.
passages.text:
So do you think it was your special duty to save your people when no one else was able?

What do you think is special about you?

[[There's nothing special about me. It just needed to be done.->Charge in and kill him 11.]]

links.text: There's nothing special about me. It just needed to be done.

passages.name: Charge in and kill him 11.
passages.text:
There's nothing at all special about you?

Do you really think that?

[[Why are you asking me so many questions? I'm not the important one here. I need to kill the goblin and finish my quest.->Charge in and kill him 12.]]

links.text: Why are you asking me so many questions? I'm not the important one here. I need to kill the goblin and finish my quest.

passages.name: Charge in and kill him 12.
passages.text:
So you don't think you are anything special...

Yet you think this is YOUR quest?

[[What? That's not what I meant.->Charge in and kill him 13.]]

links.text: What? That's not what I meant.

passages.name: Charge in and kill him 13.
passages.text:
You don't think you are anything special, so you were willing to risk throwing your life away...because there was nothing special about it?

[[That's not what I meant, either. You're twisting my words!->Charge in and kill him 14.]]

links.text: That's not what I meant, either. You're twisting my words!

passages.name: Charge in and kill him 14.
passages.text:
How does that make you feel?

[[Angry.]]

[[Sad.]]

[[Funny.]]

[[I don't know.]]

passages.name: Angry.
passages.text:
How do you know you feel angry?

[[I want to lean forward and punch you.]]

links.text: I want to lean forward and punch you.

destination.name: I want to lean forward and punch you.

passages.name: Sad.
passages.text:
How do you know you feel sad?

[[I feel sleepy and my eyes are tearing up.]]

links.text: I feel sleepy and my eyes are tearing up.

destination.name: I feel sleepy and my eyes are tearing up.

passages.name: Funny.
passages.text:
How do you know that?

[[I'm smiling, and I want to laugh.]]

links.text: I'm smiling, and I want to laugh.

destination.name: I'm smiling, and I want to laugh.

passages.name: I don't know.
passages.text:
What do you feel in your body?

[[I can't tell.]]

passages.name: I want to lean forward and punch you.
passages.text:
How do you know you want to punch me?

[[My fists are clenching.]]

passages.name: My fists are clenching.
passages.text:
Would you like to punch me?

[[Yes.->Desire to punch narrator]]

passages.name: I feel sleepy and my eyes are tearing up.
passages.text:
Do you feel like crying?

[[Yes. I feel like crying.]]

passages.name: I'm smiling, and I want to laugh.
passages.text:
Do you want to laugh right now?

[[Yes, I want to laugh.]]

passages.name: I can't tell.
passages.text:
What do you think you might be feeling that you don't want to feel?

[[I just want to kill the goblin.]]

links.text: I just want to kill the goblin.

destination.name: I just want to kill the goblin.

passages.name: I just want to kill the goblin.
passages.text:
But how do you feel about me for not letting you kill the goblin?

[[I don't know.->idk goblin 1]]

passages.name: idk goblin 1
passages.text:
Why do you want to kill the goblin?

[[So I can get the chalice and save my people.]]

links.text: So I can get the chalice and save my people.

destination.name: So I can get the chalice and save my people.

passages.name: So I can get the chalice and save my people.
passages.text:
But why do you want to do that?

How do you feel when you think about saving your people?

[[I hadn't thought about that. I don't know how I feel about that either]]

links.text: I hadn't thought about that. I don't know how I feel about that either

destination.name: I hadn't thought about that. I don't know how I feel about that either

passages.name: I hadn't thought about that. I don't know how I feel about that either
passages.text:
What will you get out of saving your people?

[[I don't know what I will get. It's just something I am supposed to do.]]

links.text: I don't know what I will get. It's just something I am supposed to do.

destination.name: I don't know what I will get. It's just something I am supposed to do.

passages.name: I don't know what I will get. It's just something I am supposed to do.
passages.text:
Who told you that you were supposed to do it?

Did I tell you that?

[[No.->You didn't tell me to save the people.]]

destination.name: You didn't tell me to save the people.

passages.name: You didn't tell me to save the people.
passages.text:
So do you still want to save the people?

[[Yes, I still want to save the people.]]

[[I don't know anymore.]]

links.text: Yes, I still want to save the people.

destination.name: Yes, I still want to save the people.

passages.name: Yes, I still want to save the people.
passages.text:
And how do you feel about the people that they need you to save them?

How do you feel that they have left you all alone to face the dangers of this tower, while they stay behind in safety?

[[I love them.]]

passages.name: I don't know anymore.
passages.text:
How am I supposed to help you get what you want if you don't know what you want?

[[I don't know.->changing mind]]

passages.name: changing mind
passages.text:
Well, it looks like that's all the time we have for today.

I think you made a lot of progress. Why don't you review the points we talked about and see how you feel over the next few days.

See you next week.

[[Ok. Thank you. Bye.]]

passages.name: Ok. Thank you. Bye.
passages.text: [[The End.]]

passages.name: I love them.
passages.text:
How do you know you love them?

[[Because I am risking my life for them.]]

links.text: Because I am risking my life for them.

destination.name: Because I am risking my life for them.

passages.name: Because I am risking my life for them.
passages.text:
That's what you are doing. That doesn't tell me how you feel.

[[I feel like I love them.]]

links.text: I feel like I love them.

destination.name: I feel like I love them.

passages.name: Yes, I want to laugh.
passages.text:
Well, go ahead. Let it out. Let out your laugh!

[[*laugh*]]

passages.name: *laugh*
passages.text:
You throw your head back and let out a huge belly laugh.

You laugh so hard that your eyes close shut and you have to lean against the wall.

Doesn't that feel...

Oh, dear...

I seem to have forgotten about the goblin.

You now have a halberd blade deep within your throat.

You find it hard to laugh as your blood sprays across the wall and drips to the floor.

[[The End.]]

passages.name: Yes. I feel like crying.
passages.text:
It's okay. We're alone here. There is no one but you and me. You can cry. It's perfectly fine.

Let the feeling come.

Let yourself feel it completely.

[[*cry*]]

passages.name: *cry*
passages.text:
Your vision becomes cloudy as the tears well up your eyes and drip down your cheeks.

Mucus begins to fill up your nose.

You begin to sob. You aren't even sure why. The sound of your emotions echoes.

Into the ears of the goblin.

Who splits your skull in two with its halberd.

You are dead.

[[The End.]]

passages.name: Desire to punch narrator
passages.text:
Go ahead. Imagine punching me.

You can't harm me here.

I'm just in your imagination.

So, go ahead. Punch me wherever you feel inclined.

[[Punch narrator in the face.]]

passages.name: Punch narrator in the face.
passages.text: [[?->Punched narrator 1]]

passages.name: Deflect the halberd's blade with your sword.
passages.text:
You manage to deflect the main force of the blow with your sword...
but your sword is now split in half, as is your right ear.

[[Strike with the broken sword.]]

[[Clutch ear and whimper like a baby.]]

links.text: Clutch ear and whimper like a baby.

destination.name: Clutch ear and whimper like a baby.

passages.name: Attack the goblin, again.
passages.text:
Before you can swing your blade a second time, your head is removed from your body.

This was not a very good back-up plan. Persistent, perhaps, but not very resourceful.

[[The End.]]

passages.name: Dodge the attack.
passages.text:
You successfully dodge the goblin's blow.

It is especially fortunate for you, as the blow landed with such strength that the goblin's halberd has become lodged within the stone floor.

At first, the goblin attempts to free his weapon, but discovering it cannot be moved, he appears to beg for mercy.

[[Kill the goblin.]]

[[Spare the goblin.]]

passages.name: Runaway.
passages.text:
The goblin's halberd descends across your spine. Your legs become useless.

The goblin then grabs your skull and flings your paralyzed body down the tower stairs. Your body flails like a rag doll as it tumbles from step to step.

Your body rests upon a heap of creatures that you recently killed.

You spend the final few hours of your existence contemplating your own futility and wishing that the rodents here would stop gnawing on your features.

[[The End.]]

passages.name: Strike with the broken sword.
passages.text:
This is a daring choice, and would certainly have made for some really striking imagery had you slain the goblin with your broken sword.

Unfortunately, your shattered blade barely made a scratch on his chestplate.

The goblin prepares to strike back...

...look, this was some really bad luck on your part.

I mean, a broken sword, really?

Your quest is going to come to an end because of some shoddy workmanship by a blacksmith?

That doesn't seem particularly fair.

Tell you what, let's take things back a little bit and try again. Just, don't let word get around that I can do this or every adventurer is suddenly going to blame all their trouble on their equipment and ask for a do-over. Deal?

[[Rewind battle.->Yes, I have a back-up plan if I don't kill him in one hit.]]

destination.name: Yes, I have a back-up plan if I don't kill him in one hit.

passages.name: Clutch ear and whimper like a baby.
passages.text:
I really respect you for picking this path.

Really.

It's a bold move to expose your own vulnerability and weakness at a time like this.

Unfortunately, the goblin does not appear to hold you in as high an estimation at the moment.

In fact, it looks like he is about to...

Well, let's just say there's no reason to cry anymore.

Or even ability to cry.

You are dead.

I wish there was something more I could have done for you, something more than just offer you my respect.

But, there isn't anything I can do now...not with you dead and all, because you decided to be a wimp about your injuries.

[[The End.]]

passages.name: Steal 1.
passages.text:
I'll also grant you (in hypothetical terms) that you might even get your hands on the Chalice of Detiny without being seen.

[[Ok.->Steal 2.]]

passages.name: Steal 2.
passages.text:
And, for the sake of argument, let's even say that you manage to get out of the room without the goblin seeing you taking the Chalice of Destiny.

[[Great.->Steal 3.]]

passages.name: Steal 3.
passages.text:
Fine, so even allowing for that possibility, how do you manage to get the chalice out of the room without the goblin recognizing the disappearance of the primary light source?

[[Hadn't thought of that.]]

passages.name: Hadn't thought of that.
passages.text:
No, I didn't think you had.

So...

[[Back to the drawing board.]]

[[Think of a way to fool the goblin.]]

[[Just grab the thing and run like the devil.]]

links.text: Think of a way to fool the goblin.

destination.name: Think of a way to fool the goblin.

links.text: Just grab the thing and run like the devil.

destination.name: Just grab the thing and run like the devil.

passages.name: Back to the drawing board.
passages.text:
That's what I thought.

[[Let me try again.->Peer into the chamber.]]

passages.name: Think of a way to fool the goblin.
passages.text:
Have you thought of a way to fool the goblin into not noticing he is in total darkness?

[[Yes.->A cunning plan 1.]]

[[Not yet.->Thinking of a plan 1.]]

passages.name: Just grab the thing and run like the devil.
passages.text:
You seize your chance to grab the Chalice of Destiny. The goblin appears slightly stunned by your unexpected entrance.

As you flee towards the exit, the goblin screams a battlecry.

You are already at the door before he can swing his halberd.

[[Continue to run down the stairs.]]

links.text: Continue to run down the stairs.

destination.name: Continue to run down the stairs.

passages.name: A cunning plan 1.
passages.text:
Oh, good.

So what is your plan?




Oh.

Hmmm.

We seem to have a little problem with the interface. 

See, I can only give you options to make choices that I've already thought of.



You wouldn't happen to be one of those people who know how to mod games, would you?

[[Yes.->Mod 1]]

[[No.->Mod 2]]

passages.name: Thinking of a plan 1.
passages.text:
In the time it has taken you to think of a plan, the goblin notices a glint of your sword reflecting light from the Chalice of Destiny.

Now, it is time to act.

But before you strike your blow, there are some practical matters to clear up.

Do you intend to make a sweeping slash or a stabbing thrust?

[[Slash.]]

[[Thrust.]]

passages.name: Punched narrator 1
passages.text: [[Hello?->Punched narrator 2.]]

passages.name: Punched narrator 2.
passages.text: [[Are you still there?->Punched narrator 3.]]

passages.name: Punched narrator 3.
passages.text: [[Anyone?->Punched narrator 4.]]

passages.name: Punched narrator 4.
passages.text: [[Are you okay?->Punched narrator 5.]]

passages.name: Punched narrator 5.
passages.text: [[Hello? Did I hurt you?->Punched narrator 6.]]

passages.name: Punched narrator 6.
passages.text: [[...->Punched narrator 7.]]

passages.name: Punched narrator 7.
passages.text: [[Hey, I can't do this without you.->Punched narrator 8.]]

links.text: Hey, I can't do this without you.

passages.name: Punched narrator 8.
passages.text: [[...->Punched narrator 9.]]

passages.name: Punched narrator 9.
passages.text: [[Does this mean it is over?->Punched narrator 10.]]

links.text: Does this mean it is over?

passages.name: Punched narrator 10.
passages.text: [[Should I quit, now?->Punched narrator 11.]]

passages.name: Punched narrator 11.
